briefTitle: Effects on Lipoprotein Metabolism From PCSK9 Inhibition Utilizing a Monoclonal Antibody

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Fasting LDL-C at screening ≥ 100 mg/dL and ≤ 190 mg/dL
* Fasting triglycerides ≤ 150 mg/dL
* Body mass index (BMI) between 18.0 and 32.0 kg/m\^2
* Framingham cardiac risk score 10% or less

Exclusion Criteria:

* Treatment with a lipid-regulating drug or over the counter supplement in the last 3 months prior to screening
* History of coronary heart disease (CHD) or CHD equivalent
* Uncontrolled hypertension
* Diabetes mellitus

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL) Apolipoprotein B-100 Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
outcomeMeasures.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of apolipoprotein B-100 in LDL which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. LDL particles were isolated from plasma by sequential ultracentrifugation, and isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C at Day 50
Percent Change From Baseline in LDL Apolipoprotein B-100 Production Rate (PR)
outcomeMeasures.description: The production rate of apolipoprotein B-100 in LDL was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. LDL particles were isolated from plasma by sequential ultracentrifugation and isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate the production rate.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Lipoprotein (a) Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
outcomeMeasures.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of lipoprotein(a) (Lp\[a\]) which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. Lp(a) was isolated from plasma using an immunoprecipitation method employing immunomagnetic beads and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Lipoprotein(a) Production Rate (PR)
outcomeMeasures.description: The production rate of lipoprotein(a) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. Lp(a) was isolated from plasma using an immunoprecipitation method employing immunomagnetic beads and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.
